Thank you everyone for you support! We have added the #Dice Boxes to the #Kickstarter reward options. We will get images better images and model previews up as soon as we can. If you have any questions please let us know! Visit: https://t.co/5CYOEDWcDx #dnd #ttrpg #gaming

We will also post the 3D viewing of the dice boxes as soon as we can and will let you know when those are live! Thank you again for all your support! The #3Dmodel previews can be seen our our website https://t.co/Ah3OqNNA5l in the Online Store > Kickstarter

Thank you for the support so far on our #Kickstarter! Its been 2 days and we've reached our main goal and are heading to our 2nd stretch goal! We'll finish updating the details tomorrow. To see those updates: https://t.co/5CYOEDWcDx #dice #ttrpg #gaming #smallbusiness #dnd

@DungeonBaker1 We frequently reference many DD 3.5 books for our adventures. They help fill out lore that might not be out in current books. When running Waterdeep: Dragonheist we used the Forgotten Realms Campaign Guide from 3.5 to better explain the history as players explore.

@SeveredSonsDnD Overall, this doesn't look bad is well thought out. However, like the base DD alignment chart, it doesn't cover everything. It's also interesting to observe that multiple DD alignments can fall into a single alignment of this chart. Ex: LG, LN, LE can be Path of Supremacy.
